data.text: @MediocreMark In the context of what we’re talking about, it’s being used as a dramatic pause/cliffhanger, so only need ellipsis. Plus, you don’t start a sentence with an ellipsis. It’s also typically used to indicate an intentional omission of a word, sentence, for example.

@MediocreMark Ah, I wondered if it was in every movie! Too tired to check. 
No need for a full-stop after an ellipsis though - it’s like a dramatic pause and/or a cliffhanger...
@NicCarrington In the Future, it will all be different.... #InterplanetaryMediaMerger :)
